leitej.locale.message

Class Messages

  • java.lang.Object
    • leitej.locale.message.Messages

  • public final class Messages
extends java.lang.Object
    This class aims to facilitate the translation of information output from the application.
    You can get an object to interact via the method getInstance() or getInstance(Locale).
    The getInstance will return a different object per Locale. The new instance will load the file called 'messages' with extension locale.getISO3Language() on the directory 'meta-inf'.

    Example of a 'messages':
    # Comment
    app.WelcomeMessage =Welcome #0. At #1
    app.End =Application has finished

    Sample code to use:
    ...
    private static final Messages MESSAGES = Messages.getInstance();
    ...
    method(){
    println(MESSAGES.get("app.WelcomeMessage", username, (new Date())));
    ...
    println(MESSAGES.get("app.End"));
    }
    ...

    Author:
    Julio Leite

    • Method Detail

      • loadArrayString

        public int loadArrayString(java.lang.String[] msgs)
        Loads from an array for translation.
        Each array element is the association of the name value.
        You should only load once for each Locale language instance.
        Parameters:
        msgs - Array with the associations of the name value
        Returns:
        number of entries placed in the message table
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If the named charset is not supported, a security manager exists and its checkRead method denies read access to the file, or an I/O error occurs

      • loadStream

        public int loadStream(java.io.InputStream inputstream,
                      java.lang.String charsetName)
               throws java.io.IOException
        Loads from an inputstream for translation.
        You should only load once for each Locale language instance.
        Parameters:
        inputstream - The inputstream
        charsetName - The name of a supported charset
        Returns:
        number of entries placed in the message table
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If the named charset is not supported, or an I/O error occurs

      • loadFile

        public int loadFile(java.lang.String pathname,

        Loads a file for translation.
        You should only load once for each Locale language instance.
        Parameters:
        pathname - A pathname string
        charsetName - The name of a supported charset
        Returns:
        number of entries placed in the message table
        Throws:
